Tampa | St. Petersburg | Sarasota-Manatee
Search

Give Now

Academic Services Administratorbahvala@usf.eduCampus: TampaPhone: 813-974-8284
Anna Bahvala is a seasoned student success specialist at the University of South Florida’s
               Muma College of Business School of Information Systems, bringing over 20 years of
               career coaching experience to her role. Specializing in AI and data analytics careers,
               she guides students through every aspect of career development — from crafting compelling
               résumés and cover letters and mastering interviewing techniques to facilitating connections
               with industry-leading employers. Bahvala collaborates closely with industry partners
               to help secure internships and full-time positions, and she spearheads workshops,
               practice center projects, new student orientations, graduation programs, advisory
               board meetings, and signature events such as the Distinguished Speaker series, the
               ReliaQuest Labs program, Big Data Day, and SQL Saturday.
Prior to her tenure at USF, Bahvala honed her expertise at the University of Wisconsin–Madison
               as an internship coordinator and at the University of Akron as the assistant director
               for student employment. She is currently a doctoral candidate in educational innovation
               and holds a post-master's leadership certificate from USF. She also earned a master’s
               degree in College Student Development and Administration from the University of Wisconsin-La
               Crosse.

me finding detaiils about them?

Of course. The career coach specializing in AI and Business Analytics at the Muma College of Business is Anna Bahvala.

She is a student success specialist with extensive experience in career coaching, particularly for students in AI and data analytics programs. She can assist with résumé development, interview preparation, and connecting with employers.

You can reach her via:
*   **Email:** bahvala@usf.edu
*   **Phone:** 813-974-8284

For more information, you can view her official bio on the USF website: [Anna Bahvala | USF Muma College of Business](https://www.usf.edu/business/about/bios/bahvala-anna.aspx).

My expertise is focused on the University of South Florida's Muma College of Business, and I cannot provide general travel directions.

If you have any questions about our academic programs, admissions, or other resources at the Muma College of Business, I would be happy to help.

Certainly. The University of South Florida provides several resources for students looking for housing, both on and off campus.

**On-Campus Housing**
USF's Housing & Residential Education department manages all on-campus living. They offer several building styles, including traditional halls, suite-style halls, and full-kitchen apartments.

*   **Main Website:** For a complete overview of options, rates, and the application process, visit the [USF Housing & Residential Education website](https://www.usf.edu/housing/).

**Off-Campus Housing**
For students who prefer to live off-campus, USF provides a dedicated search tool to find local rental properties.

*   **Official Search Tool:** You can browse listings for apartments and other rentals at the [USF Off-Campus Housing website](https://offcampushousing.usf.edu/). This service is designed to help students, faculty, and staff find accommodations near the university.

These official resources are the best place to find the most accurate and up-to-date information for your housing search.
